newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica industrials still up on Dow, rate cut talk.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica industrials still up on Dow, rate cut talk.

text.p: 1020 GMT - South African noon industrial shares still firm, but slightly off peaks, helped by a firm Wall Street overnight and hopes that Reserve Bank Governor Chris Stals could cut interest rates before year-end.
* But golds softer on a dull bullion price. Dealers say overall volumes moderate with around 360 million rand worth of shares changing hands in market seen ending on positive territory.

* Chemicals, oils and plastics firm Engen sees high volumes after stockbrokers Deutche Morgan Grenfell sell a million shares on the stock for around 21 million rand to a local broker. The stock, however, sheds 25 cents to 21.75 rand with volumes at 24.3 million rand.
* Information technology firm Q Data adds 105 cents to 10.95 rand on news compay had signed a three million rand deal to supply hardware and software to medical aid firm Interdoc.
* Industrials add 18.3 points to 9,140.7, golds shed 4.8 points to 977.8, and all-shares gain 4.2 points to 7,477.9.
